title: I come back, this forum is dead. Ah well.
content:
A few facts.

1. This forums isn't dead, otherwise it wouldn't have anyone posting at all now that is completely dead.

2. LL left? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img]

3. No one used to care about my posts and still never do. So I really dont give a crap.

4. The only way keen could REALLY come back is if Tom Hall got the wrights.

title: Re: I come back, this forum is dead. Ah well.
content:
1. If it were dead there wouldn't be at least ten people posting a day, eh.

2. Yeah, LL left, unfortunately. A friend of hers, Sarah, joined in though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

3. I don't think I know you (yet), so I can't really judge on that until you post more.

4. Or rights. But yeah, there's no hope of there ever coming a new Keen game before 2050... Unless that happens. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

Well I haven't been on ezboard for at least 5 months if not more. But I was almost as bad as Harvey. If any of you remember him.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

title: Re: ...
content:
1. Well, suit yourself.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

2. Yeah, but I believe she'll be back sooner or later. And yeah, her friend Sarah who had never had an account here before joined pretty soon after LL left and started posting frequently.

3. If they are like this then no wonder. I can't remember much of them, true. But probably I didn't miss anything that important. Did you release something cool?

4. I don't think anyone has said anything opposing this claim. Yes, the real returning of Keen will happen when Tom Hall gets the rights. Before that appears the Anti-Keen, horrible beast fooling most of the people to believe that Keen has returned. (And that has happened with the "Keen" GBC.) So, Keen should be here sooner or later! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: ...
content: The concept and most of the game design is Tom's. Romero did a bunch of coding, Adrian did some excellent art, and the other guys did...stuff, but the soul of the series is all Tom's contribution.

title: Re: ...
content:
Indeed. Keen was Tom's idea, and he designed the worlds and ideas. And did many levels. And drew the Keen 4-6 sprite, IIRK. Or was it Keen 1-3? Anyways.. He's the mastermind who really created the Keeniverse.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: well...
content:
iD is still a powerhouse as far as Graphics Engines are concerned--they've licensed out the Doom3 engine, and Romero is very respected for the work he's done. Competition has been cropping up, though, with the Epic team's Unreal 3 engine really knocking the socks off of the industry (because of its multithreaded abilities).

Didn't iD have an outside company come in and help produce the content for Quake4? I've heard the argument since Quake3 Arena came out that "iD doesn't make games; they make tech demos for their engines," which is fine because it still makes them money and advances the industry--but clearly iD is not the go-to company for original ideas.

I'm not sure I'd want to see what iD as a conglomerate company entity did with the Keen idea at this point... But it'd be cool to hear some passing thoughts Tom had on the matter.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: well...
content:
Interesting. So Tom is the community hero?

I wish him good luck in getting those rights; companies as a rule are about as eager to give up rights to anything as your table salt is of splitting into sodium and chlorine; its a natural law or somesuch.

title: Tom!
content: From all the documentation on Keen, it's mentioned somewhere that Tom suggested Billy's character was a charicature of himself at age 8. Also, the way he responds to interviews, and his family-conscious method of game design really sings to me... He's an admirable fellow.

content:
